etymologies: mid 17th century: from medieval Latin haecceitas, from Latin haec, feminine of hic ‘this’

definitions: that property or quality of a thing by virtue of which it is unique or describable as “this (one).”.
shortDefinitions: that property or quality of thing by virtue of which it is unique or describable as 'this one'

definitions: the property of being a unique and individual thing

examples.text: he has a paramount concern with haecceity, the thisness of things

shortDefinitions: property of being unique and individual thing
